#geomob

London meetup focused on geoinnovation - for fun or profit.
 
Home > 26 May 2016

Summer #geomob - July 14th at Geovation Hub

Many thanks to all of you who came out to our May event, and a special congratulations to Andrew Trigg of the Land Registry who won the SplashMaps best speaker prize.

Our summer event will take place on the evening of July 14th, I’m delighted to announce we’ll be back in Clerkenwell at the Ordnance Survey’s Geovation Hub. It is a great facility and we’re fortunate that they’re once again hosting us. The evening will follow the time-honoured routine: we will have five speakers, each will present to the group for 10-15 minutes then field a few questions from the audience. Afterwards we’ll vote for the best speaker and then head to the pub where the drinks are generously made possible by our sponsors: OpenCage Data, Knowwhere Consulting, What3Words, iGeolise, and Splashmaps.

The talks start at 18:30 and you should please sign up on Lanyrd so we have an idea of the numbers to expect.

Our speakers for the evening are:

  • Gary Gale, updating us on what What3Words is up to

  • Max Stephan of Geovation Hub, telling us about all the support they offer geo start-ups
  • Sarah Pritchard, founder of Treasure Pocket

  • Giuseppe Sollazzo will muse about Open Data

  • Christopher Wesson will tells about mapping Mars

All the makings of another great geo evening. If you unfortunately can’t make it in July our next event will be on the 7th of September. 

Final note: we’re always on the look out for more sponsors. Please get in touch if your brand wants to support geo-innovation. 

Have a great summer everyone, see you at 18:30 on July 14th

Ed
